WorkItem.Description:
My batch tool is setup as 6 character files in these modules in order:
- Moonkin
- Moonkin
- Tree
- Bear
- Cat
- Moonkin
 
When running progressive optimize with maximum thoroughness and max rounds at mid point, the optimization on all character sometimes forget that I have JC gems and profession enabled and wants to remove 1 to 3 of dragonseyes. This happens more frequently on later character files but not as much on the first 2 moonkin files.
 
The optimization for Tree, Bear, and Cat (character 3 to 5) doesn't use their respective gemming templates. I usually ends up with Bear and Cat equiping all Runed and Reckless. As far as I can tell, the optimizing was done using the template from the moonkin files, and no dragonseyes.
 
See attached zip file for the batch file + all 6 character files.

Comments.Message: Forgot to mention, I first observed this problem in 2.3.16. The behavior stays the same in 2.3.17 and 18.

First question, why are you putting your Tree build in there at all? Progressive Optimize makes sense for Bear/Cat or Cat/Bear, but Tree doesn't make any sense as they don't share any gear at all (except maybe DMC:G).

Ok, ya it would help if I read it a little more thoroughly....

Tree/Moonkin together works and Bear/Cat together separately, trying to do them all at once is probably what's killing you.
I don't think that will change anything. Even the tree character is using moonkin's gemming template and "forget" about that JC is enabled.

If you make sure your first moonkin template has all the gear marked (all specs) then mark every gem and enchant available manually that you need then the optimise will work fine.   It is an issue with the gem templates but I have managed to work around it.

Can i suggest using two separate batches?  Use one for moonkin/tree and a separate one for cat/bear.    The amount of time you save running the optimises is massive as not only are you doing half the optimises but you drastically reduce the number of items the optimiser has to look at.
Does this issue persist in the current version (2.3.19)?
I think this was related to availability of custom gemming templates, should be fixed now.
